wikipedia_page.main:
Raymond Sharp (born 16 November 1969) is a Scottish former footballer, who played for Dunfermline Athletic, Stenhousemuir, Preston North End, Forfar Athletic, Alloa Athletic, Cowdenbeath, East Fife and Montrose.
Sharp made four appearances for the Scotland national under-21 football team.

response: Edward Ray Sharpe (born February 8, 1938) is an American singer, guitarist, and songwriter. His best-known single was "Linda Lu". Sharpe was described by one record producer as "the greatest white-sounding black dude ever".Mike Callahan and David Edwards, The Dot Records Story, Part 2, Bsnpubs.com

Born in Fort Worth, Texas, Sharpe grew up influenced by country as well as blues music.  He learned guitar, influenced by Chuck Berry records, and in 1956 formed his own trio, Ray Sharpe and the Blues Whalers, with Raydell Reese (piano) and Cornelius Bell (drums), and they became popular playing rock and roll in Fort Worth clubs. Dik de Heer, "Ray Sharpe", Black Cat Rockabilly. Retrieved October 6, 2014 His recording career started in Phoenix, Arizona in April 1958, when Lee Hazlewood produced his single, "That's the Way I Feel" / "Oh, My Baby's Gone".
*Ray Sharp (badminton), Badminton player and medallist in 1970 British Commonwealth Games
